website_summaries.verdict: This grinder coffee maker lets you easily select the coarseness of your grind and can make either small or large amounts of coffee.
pros: Will brew up to 10 cups of coffee
Allows you to fine grind for espresso
Easier to clean and maintain than other grind and brews
Uses a hot plate instead of a carafe
cons: The grinder on this KRUPS does not seem to work as smoothly as the KRUPS standalone grinders

customer_reviews.title: Kraps Out Quickly
customer_reviews.text: This was an absolute piece of trash. It worked for two days, and it was great. Then it died unceremoniously, making noise but not grinding, then brewing hot water. I did the troubleshooting that was recommended, quadruple checked that I was going through the correct steps and using it properly, and it still did not work. I am extremely disappointed, and based on the reviews of other buyers who had the same experience, opted for a return and refund rather than a replacement. What an absolutely garbage product. So annoyed.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas M

customer_reviews.title: Makes the best coffee ever!!
customer_reviews.text: I had the older version of this Krups Grind and Brew. It made the perfect cup of coffee every time! I was crushed when it finally didn't work anymore, but elated to find the new model here on Amazon. It's even better than the original model. Amazon always has what I need, carrying quality product lines for the best prices. My Krups arrived as promised in excellent condition. LOVE THIS PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.author: MaryLouise Brennan

customer_reviews.title: LOVE IT!!! EASY AND SIMPLE!
customer_reviews.text: I really love this coffee pot. Its easy to figure out. It grinds the beans and puts in the filter how much needed by itself, just press how many cups you want and how strong you want your coffee and bam....perfect coffee. It fits on the counter just fine and it's easy to clean. I've seen people complain about the grinder and noise.... mine has not had any hiccups and it's a grindr...it grinds beans.... that makes noise. If you dont want fresh ground beans then buy preground. Anyway. I love this coffee pot machine and I have NO complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Paul Sikora II

customer_reviews.title: Came used and then broke after 2nd use
customer_reviews.text: The product came used and I know this because coffee beans came out once I opened the lid to the product. Despite it being used and returned to Amazon, I decided to keep the item anyways. Three days after using the item, I went to program the coffee maker and it crashed. It started to grind coffee beans then stopped and that was the end of that coffee maker. I unplugged the device, plugged it back in and troubleshooted the device in accordance to the manual and nothing. The only good thing out of this was that Amazon allowed me to return the device and was reimbursed a couple of days later. If you purchase this item, be careful.
customer_reviews.author: Toma Smith

customer_reviews.title: Two Failures - Do not Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I purchased my initial unit and upon its arrival became suspicious since there were residual coffee grounds in the grinding compartment. It appeared to have been previously used. When attempting to brew the initial batch it would not grind a sufficient quantity of beans to make a pot of coffee. The grinder seemed defective in that only a small amount of grounds were produced. After multiple attempts to operate I returned the unit to Amazon for a replacement. The second unit arrived and worked great for the first 3-4 pots of coffee. Then the second unit failed to initiate the grinding/brewing process following setup. There are obviously reliability problems with this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Marcey

customer_reviews.title: Defective from day one
customer_reviews.text: Had 2 of previous models (over a period of many, many years) of grind and brew from Krups and were great, this one did not pump water to be able to brew with ground coffee from day one, kept it as we normally always use beans and grind, however after 4 days would not grind or pump the water at all. Very disappointed and returned for refund and will not purchase a grind and brew from Krups again. This model is not nearly as good as predecessor.
customer_reviews.author: Marsha L. Knapik

customer_reviews.title: Brews weak coffee
customer_reviews.text: Did not really live up to expectations. Was super excited to receive the product. In the end I feel like water runs too quickly through the included filter resulting in very weak coffee. I've tried several beans now, have the grind size set to the finest setting and strength setting set to strong with no luck. I've even tried grinding extra beans for the amount of water without success. Update(1/8/2019) I'm returning this product. This thing is either broken or just brews bad coffee. It was also received with evidence of prior use -- tiny coffee grounds in the shoot leading from the grinder to the strainer.
customer_reviews.author: Zach Colon

customer_reviews.title: Broke and only 18 months of use
customer_reviews.text: I've had this machine for a year and a half. Other than being super (and I mean super) loud when it grinds beans, it was ok. And then...it just stopped working. Well, to be fair, the grinding part still works, so now I use it as a huge bean grinder and then pour the grounds and hot water into my press pot. I have no idea why it brewed coffee just fine one day and then didn't the next. Perhaps 18 months is a decent life length for a coffee maker, but I had hoped for better.
customer_reviews.author: Camilla

customer_reviews.title: Failure after Only 2 Months
customer_reviews.text: I bought this KRUPS automatic grinding coffee pot for my mom, after she'd killed after different Cuisinart Grind 'n Brew models seemed to last only a year in her care. Amazon reviews indicated that this KRUPS machine was likely of higher quality. It was certainly more expensive. Sad to say that my mom killed this coffee pot in less than 2 months! No: I don't know how she did it. Yes: I do now have it, myself, and I intend to try to resurrect it. ...but I'll never buy another one! My mom picked up another Cuisinart. Guess we'll get ready to buy her a new one in a a year!
customer_reviews.author: IlDavo

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I want to like this coffee maker, but only a few months in, I just can’t. Right off the bat, opening and closing the water area is difficult due to a flimsy plastic latch. Likewise, removing the filter basket is very annoying due to flimsy plastic parts. C’mon, Krups, make the daily tasks easy. Beyond that, the coffee grinder jammed up and refuses to get the coffee to the actual filter. I have vacuumed and cleaned endlessly and it simply won’t work anymore. Back to grinding the beans myself. This unit is junk. I will avoid the brand in the future.
customer_reviews.author: pw-seattle

customer_reviews.title: Prepare to spend $$$ on whole coffee beans
customer_reviews.text: Overall this coffee maker is exactly what you would want from a Grind & Brew machine. The reason for 3 stars is the crazy amount of coffee beans it goes through. We have tried every setting but we still end up with half of the grinds not even wet - way too much waste for the amount of beans we're going through. We have actually switched back to ground coffee which negates the purpose of having the grind option.
customer_reviews.author: BRalph11

customer_reviews.title: It works great so far *updated"
customer_reviews.text: What can I say. It works. Grinds the coffee, heats the water. The hot water touches the grinded up coffee beans and makes coffee that tastes like coffee. Purchased in Jan 2020 EDIT: 3/30/20 (5 stars). I see a lot of reviews how this unit stops working. After 4 months of use, it's still grinding & brewing perfectly. I see other reviews about how it doesn't grind the beans right - for me, it grinds very fine for strong coffee. If you want stronger coffee, put in less water. Simple.
customer_reviews.author: adhuntr

customer_reviews.title: No instructions included!!
customer_reviews.text: I don't like this. First of all, it came with NO instructions, I had to hunt them down online, the coffee maker is not easy to figure out, at all. I had a Kitchen Aid coffee maker for years then came to this one and I hate it. It only stays on for 2 hours, the grinder doesn't grind well, there's always chunks. The pot leaks no matter how much is in there.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Don’t do it
customer_reviews.text: If light brown water is what you’re looking for, this is your product. Ive only used the machine 3 times, and all 3 times all it’s brewed is a light brown water. I’m using the grinder for whole beans, I have it set on Strong, I’ve tried 3 different settings for the grind, I’ve tried listing 10 cup and only put in 8 cups of water, but the result is the same every time. I’m going to go out and purchase a machine instead of ordering on Amazon. Very disappointed 😞
customer_reviews.author: Laurie Gallegos

customer_reviews.title: Junk Java Machine
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in August of 2019 and need to replace it. The grinder gets clogged so the beans don’t make it to the basket and the coffee ends up weak.... like colored water. The steam it creates dogs up the window so you can see the time and/or the settings. This thing is a lemon. I should have returned it the first time we had an issue with it. I thought a KRUPS product would be higher quality.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 3 weeks!
customer_reviews.text: We were so excited to get this. Used it for 3 weeks and the grinder stopped working. We did everything we could to clean out the grounds. Sucked it all out with a shop vac and still not working. Very disappointed! Bought a separate coffee grinder (kitchen aid which works great), and continued to use the brewing portion of the machine. It has since stopped working correctly in that the water gets backed up and doesnt flow through so when you pull the carafe out , water pours out. Krupps did send a return ups label but in all honesty we dont want another one. It's going in the garbage. Dont buy this product.
customer_reviews.author: Tr

customer_reviews.title: does not know how to count
customer_reviews.text: I select 2 cups and it always brews all the water that is in the reservoir, this has been happening since I bought this 3 weeks ago. I did not pay this much money for this machine now to know how to count. This machine has wasted the beans by making water downed coffee. Also, every now and then the display screen does not work , the display is illegible and buttons do not response...trash. I usually do not give bad reviews but for the price this is unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: chris ortiz

customer_reviews.title: Glad I bought this
customer_reviews.text: This is a great low maintenance machine. Great tasting coffee is waiting for me every morning. The auto programing is the best. Makes my work days a little better. If it turned into a beer brewer on the weekends it would be the perfect machine!
customer_reviews.author: Ozzy Mackenzie

customer_reviews.title: Perfection
customer_reviews.text: Easy to clean and descale, easy to use, burr grinder can be loud, but grinds the coffee well for a built-in grinder. The machine makes delicious coffee every time, whether you grind whole beans or use the basket filter for ground coffee. The programmable function has been working flawlessly, and I have been getting woken up by the aroma of fresh coffee weekdays and weekends every single morning since I purchased this machine in the beginning of February 2020. I do my part and descale every 2 weeks with this heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Delyana Varbanova

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use ... does what it claims to do.
customer_reviews.text: Simple to use coffee maker with grinder for beans. Easy to set up and clean after usage. Makes a decent cup of coffee but I'm still experimenting as I've only had it for a few weeks. Seems to do well with regular coffee but tried decaf beans one time and the taste was a bit weak. Not sure if this was caused by the beans or the machine. Only complaint it that its a bit larger than I had anticipated so it takes up quite a bit of space on our kitchen counter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the most terrible coffee machine I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: In not so many words this coffee machine is by far the worst I have ever owned. We made coffee... used good quality beans and all we got was a light brown drip... Tried all the grind options, just in case and we only used the Strong Option for the aroma. Needles to say that we are returning it today. Also, like it wasn't disappointing enough to be unable to make a decent cup of joe, we need to return it at a Kohl's store... not at a UPS location which was the most convenient way.
customer_reviews.author: Monica U

customer_reviews.title: Quit working 2 days after short 30 day return period ended
customer_reviews.text: Very good coffee maker with burr grinder, and adjustable coffee strength and cup sizes. Perfect for one person or the whole family. Also keeps the coffee very hot. Only downside, did not work on the pre-ground setting. Not a biggie, I always grind mine. But could be a problem for others. Update 6/22/20: downgrading my review to 1 star. Grinder engine started working erratically, then slowed, slowed, then quit working 2 days after my 30 day return window closed. Now the entire machine doesn't work. It was great while it lasted!
customer_reviews.author: Michigan customer

customer_reviews.title: You have to put the right amount of water in every time you brew.
customer_reviews.text: My only gripe is that it only Pre-measures beans but not the water. That being said, if you put in 10 cups of water and intend to brew 2 cups of coffee and save the other 8 cups of water for later brewing, you will receive some VERY watered down coffee. This is EXTREMELY annoying that you pay $150 for a coffee pot, and you have to put water in every single time.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle B. Ladd

customer_reviews.title: BUYER BEWARE
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I expected to be able to count on a brand name that has a solid history behind it of good product. To say this is a COLOSSAL FAIL would be polite. Not even two months in this POS no longer grinds. The poorly designed lid was bad enough making a simple pour of coffee without spilling a distant memory. It's December 23rd and the LAST THING I wanted to deal with was a dead coffee pot. Well... It's done now and I will NEVER COME BACK. This company is permanently crossed off my list.
customer_reviews.author: Coffeegirl

customer_reviews.title: Frequent cleaning is added inconvenience.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an old brew & grind (that stopped grinding) by Cuisinart, and now I really miss that coffee maker! First, it makes great coffee. I love that I can adjust grind size and strength. Stays hot. Auto-brewing is fabulous. BUT, I have to clean the grinding compartment much more often than I think one should. In truth, it isn't the cleaning that is such a big deal, but it is the hatch that covers where you clean that is tricky and difficult to remove. It's just as challenging to put it back in place. It's just an added step that makes this pot a bit more inconvenient than I thought it would be.
customer_reviews.author: A. Granite

customer_reviews.title: Had potential...
customer_reviews.text: We really wanted to love this grind and brew machine. The first one lasted about a month bwfore the grinder stopped. The replacement lasted a week before the grinder stopped.
customer_reviews.author: kate kemp

customer_reviews.title: Beware, this won’t last you very long if you’re a daily drinker.
customer_reviews.text: While it produced consistently good coffee over the 1.5 years we owned this, we went to power it on this Saturday morning and it didn’t pump water or heat. It appears as if a blown fuse which is irreparable is the culprit, so now it’s in our trash. There are more durable grind and brew machines on the market that last much longer. We’re going back to Cuisinart after being happy with the last machine we had from them that performed the same task.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Broke after the second use
customer_reviews.text: I made two pots of coffee in it, both with the whole bean grinder. The third time, it simply would not start the grinding process. I unplugged it and plugged it back in and the display was messed up. The backlight would not come on and it just displayed "544". Pushing the Grind/Brew button just changed it to "555" then "666" then "777" then 5, 6, 7, 8 etc. It's obviously broken. This thing is junk.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Sander

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: When set to brew 2 or 4 cups it always brewed twice as much and produced very weak coffee even on the bold setting. Also used a lot more coffee beans than manual coffee makers. It also employs a basket filter as opposed to the cone filters Krups used to make a point of the fact that cone filters make better coffee. Where did the quality go?
customer_reviews.author: Moonsppppiner's.moonsppiners

customer_reviews.title: Love it true coffee flavor
customer_reviews.text: After being a Keurig user of 5 + years I am now never going back! this machine makes Wonderful Coffee you don't know what you're missing! Just be sure to clean the little Grinded catcher compartment with the supplied brush just like they say every other week to keep it running perfect you won't need an alarm clock in the morning when this thing starts up
customer_reviews.author: karen l paguaga

customer_reviews.title: Flavor, ease of use and reliability
customer_reviews.text: It is a decent machine unfortunately the coffee get immediately cool, infact it doesn't come out hot at all and I like a hot cup of coffee. I still haven't figured out how to set the automatic brew and I couldn't reach a customer service human being. It's unfortunate because I passed up a Cousinart that would have been much cheaper to purchase and I have used in the past with great sucess to this one.
customer_reviews.author: Adele

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and maintain, coarseness setting doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I love this coffee machine. Works great. There is a courseness setting that doesn't work. It won't even start grinding on alternative courseness settings. I had purchased another one that I returned for this reason and the new came with the same problem but I kept it. So I would say, if that is an important option for you then purchase a different model. And now I stupidly broke the pot itself. I wish Amazon put links to replacement parts on the same page as the machine itself.
customer_reviews.author: C. Whelpley

customer_reviews.title: Grinder Feature Can Not Do Coarse
customer_reviews.text: I have used a Krups grinder/coffee maker for years. I wore out my last one. My only reason for a 4-star rather than a 5-star rating is that the grind selector "coarse" does not churn out a coarse grind. Such a disappointment. However, I use more coffee beans attempting to approach the flavor I desire.
customer_reviews.author: KanKan

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic pot
customer_reviews.text: Love this coffee pot! The only thing I wish were different is that the container holding the beans was bigger and the little compartment that needs to be cleaned out was a little easier to access. Otherwise great coffee pot/grinder! Highly rexommend!!
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Hutto

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 3 Months!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Worked great at first, then started shutting off on it's own for no reason in the middle of brewing, and now when you plug it in, it comes on and then shuts off within 15 seconds. Now I have to go through the hassle of finding a repair location to have it fixed for what I am sure will be covered by warranty - Would not buy this item again!
customer_reviews.author: Robert H. Allen

customer_reviews.title: never go back to regular coffee pot after using this.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my dad for a gift. He drinks about a cup of coffee on a daily basis. I got this upgrade his old coffee pot. He stated that he will never go back to regular coffee pot after using this.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Lynch

customer_reviews.title: Received 2 used machines
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea if this machine is good or not. When I received it, it was cracked and there appeared to be coffee grounds in it. Ok, I accidentally got a used machine. Returned and got a replacement. When I opened the box I saw that the 2nd machine had even more coffee grounds in it. Sorry, but I'm not going to use a machine that someone had already used and returned. Very disappointed. Not replacing with a 3rd.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Machine
customer_reviews.text: High quality good looking machine. The plastic is not glossy, it almost looks and feels like rubber. Easy to set clock. Looks and feels like it should cost twice as much. No water window but there is an easy to read guage in the tank. If you are giving as a gift it comes in a really classy looking box.
customer_reviews.author: Don Fort Lauderdale

customer_reviews.title: Quickly breaks down with no way to fix it.
customer_reviews.text: As others have cautioned, the KM785D50 coffee machine breaks down after a just a few weeks. First, the coffee strength settings stopped working. Next, the grinder began channeling coffee grinds into the inside of the *machine* (as in, behind the enclosed black plastic shell) rather than into the coffee filter cup. Without these selling features this machine an expensive waste of counter space. Worse, there are no ways to fix these issues because of Karups's choice to use proprietary triangle head screws to fasten the parts--a choice which I can only proscribe to ensuring that you will be forced to buy a new machine.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Worst coffee ever!
customer_reviews.text: No difference is coarse or fine grind. No matter what brand or type of coffee is used it all tastes the same. Ugh! Sorry that I missed the return deadline. Obviously I won't be testing the durability section. Too embarrassed to give this to a thrift shop.
customer_reviews.author: Reno Reader

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this machine!!!
customer_reviews.text: Machine brakes after a few months of using it. Bad designee on nor being able to remove the hopper in order to properly clean the grinder and remove and beans that get stuck. Just like the airlines the customer service of Krups promises a bunch of stuff and then never delivers. Is this the new norm over promises under deliver?
customer_reviews.author: Juan Carlos Dalitz

customer_reviews.title: Stopped grinding the beans
customer_reviews.text: Today the machine won't even start grinding the beans or heart the water. I cleaned it, unplugged and replugged and it is still won't start. When it used to work, it was great and I thought the people who leave negative feedback were crazy. I was wrong. Read the negative feedback folks.
customer_reviews.author: quis

customer_reviews.title: Very nice coffee if you use paper filters and the finest grind setting
customer_reviews.text: Great coffeemaker, build quality is impressive. The controls are easy to use and LCD screen is just good for the application. Downsides are coffee brew intensity if you use included gold tone filter, I use paper filters along with the finest grind setup just then the strength and flavor intensifies a lot, I didn't like neither the glass made jar, it seems to be fragile. When you're washing it, you feel it is going to break in your hands.
customer_reviews.author: Nafalo

customer_reviews.title: Malfunctioned after 2 months no communication from Krupps after I sent in for repair
customer_reviews.text: The grinder stopped working two months after purchase. I sent the product back to the manufacturer to be repaired. It’s been more than 5 weeks since I sent the product to manufacturer and there has been no communication. I called customer service to get an update only to be told by a robot that they are not answering customer service phone calls during COVID. I sent in an inquiry using their form email and still no communication. I’ve just ordered a new coffee maker and intend to get a refund for this Krupps junker. DO NOT BUY THIS COFFEE MAKER/ GRINDER COMBO. Complete waste of time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Darst

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy. Listen to the cautionary reviews
customer_reviews.text: I didn't listen to the reviews that said reliability was a problem. I should have. After a dozen or so uses the grinder broke. Most likely because the little "hat" broke off sending plastic chunks everywhere (see picture). Very poor design I tried disassembling and cleaning but no luck. I now have an expensive one month old filter brewer until I throw it in the garbage.
customer_reviews.author: David Deckert

customer_reviews.title: Failure to Grind- Krups KM785D50 Grind and Brew Auto-Start Maker with Built in Burr Coffee Grinder
customer_reviews.text: I would have rated this coffee maker 5 stars because it is a wonderful machine; however, we have been using it for approximately three weeks and so far the coffee grinder has not functioned on three occasions which is extremely frustrating. We tried everything - unplugging it, taking everything out and starting all over, changing the fineness of the grind and nothing worked. (The troubleshooting suggestion in the manual was of no help.) Eventually when we pushed the button it started - sometimes 15 minutes later, sometimes a day later. I am hesitant to ask for a replacement because I am concerned about the next one having the same problem.
customer_reviews.author: CD

customer_reviews.title: The coffee maker is a bit complicated to use, not intuitive. Early problems.
customer_reviews.text: The instruction book in English could use improvement. The operation is not intuitive. After years using another coffee maker, I decided to try Krups, based on good reviews. According to instructions, it requires descaling after 70 uses. So on schedule, (a little over two months) I descaled it. The descale icon did not go off (therefore grinder will not work) . I went through the process four (4) more times. No luck. Called customer service and confirmed that I was doing the operation correctly. Answer: return it! Of course my Amazon return date has passed! Now what?
customer_reviews.author: G. Fitzgerald

customer_reviews.title: Broken Machine
customer_reviews.text: I was thrilled when the machine arrived--it looked great and I was excited to have access to fresh-ground coffee. Unfortunately, the product was broken. Specifically, the water pump would not bring water from the basin to be brewed. That's kind of an important part of the whole coffee machine thing. The grinder, on the other hand, purred like a well-honed machine--it would have made great ground coffee that could never have been brewed. I do not know if my experience is anomalous, but I do know that I resent having to spend tomorrow afternoon going to UPS to return this product. In any case, you have been warned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a month - UPDATED
customer_reviews.text: Unit stopped working after a month. Specifically, the grinder would start to grind beans, but would not pass the grinds to the filter unit. Repeated cleanings of the grinds pathway from the grinder to the filter unit did nothing to resolve the problem. Customer service indicated this problem couldn't be troubleshot over the phone, but did offer to replace with a new unit provided I shipped the old one back to them. Nevertheless, it's a headache to have a product like this essentially fail after only a month. UPDATE: Got a second unit, which also failed after a month. STAY AWAY FROM THIS PRODUCT.
customer_reviews.author: Davy Jones

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT MAKE GOOD COFFEE.
customer_reviews.text: Bells and whistles are ok but the coffee comes out lousy. I have done all sorts of adjustments and still no good. I've had Cuisinart grind and brew for many years. Worked great. I was fooled by the KRUPS name and decided to try this one. Thumbs down.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: MUCH better than our old blade grinder coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker, while not REAL quite, is quieter than our old blade grinder coffee pot. It grinds beans to a finer grind and now we use about 25% less beans and have better tasting coffee. We are going to buy another one to keep in our motor home.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Butzin

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a month
customer_reviews.text: I loved this at first. I had it set to start at 3:30am so when I got up at 4am the coffee was ready! Then it just stopped working. I could hear it grinding but nothing was actually going into the filter and nothing but hot water ended up in the pot. I sent the machine back two weeks ago and still haven’t heard back if they could fix it or send me a new one and I’m still out the $120
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The grind feture is a problem
customer_reviews.text: The first 30 days I owned this machine, I loved it, however, the nature of coffee makes the grind feature an issue. The steam from the machine causes the coffee grounds to gum up the grinding feature and it is extremely difficult to clean. We have stopped using that feature and now after owning this machine for a year, the filter itself is constantly getting clogged. This is with regular cleaning. I would NOT purchase this product again,
customer_reviews.author: catherine0605

customer_reviews.title: Grinder is not good.
customer_reviews.text: The machine in overall is good and robust. The major issue is the grinder, definitely not good, don't properly grind de beans in thin as a powder (correct way to make a coffee), even if you choose the thinnest option. So, the coffee is always weak and it doesn't extract the best of the beans, it doesn't matter the quality of your beans. I bought a machine for the convenience of the grinder, and pay a lot of money because of that, but I am currently using my manual grinder. So, I am checking to return the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tasting coffee
customer_reviews.text: We love a grind and brew coffee maker and this one is perfect for our needs. Our last one would get water or humidity inside. This one is easy to use and easy to clean. So far we are very happy and hope it lasts for many years.
customer_reviews.author: D. Nuce

customer_reviews.title: Does not work
customer_reviews.text: I bought one and had to return it because only after 4 times I used it the thing stopped grinding the coffee, I thought well let me try another one so I requested a new one. Then I get that one and the coffee would not drip into the coffee pot. I would have to stand by the machine and literally hold the pot to touch the drip in order for the coffee to come out. I was done with the chances.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Quiroz

customer_reviews.title: I love my coffee
customer_reviews.text: Fill the hopper with beans. Set the strength. Push start. It’s that easy. The mesh filter rinses clean easy. I brew Tarazza Costa Rican whole beans and everyone who visits has nothing but rave reviews for the coffee I serve.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Mendoza

customer_reviews.title: If you like tea this is the grinder for you
customer_reviews.text: I’m very disappointed I read all the instructions I wanted to grind my beans into strong coffee I chose fine grind and the strong setting for 10 cups four times what I got was more like tea returning because I don’t want tea I want strong coffee!
customer_reviews.author: Julianne Hall

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and great cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: Just got my KM785D50 Grind and Brew from Krupps (some of these reviews seem to be for other models). Everything was included as advertised. Setup, including rinsing removable parts and running one pot of water without coffee was easy and just as the instructions outlined. I’ve brewed the first test pot. I set everything on medium (strength and grind) and used some very fresh, strong Peet’s French Roast beans. The grinder did not have any issues. I’d say it was moderately loud — not unexpected for a home grinder. Nice strong cup of Joe, just how I like it. I’ll be trying other coffees and settings. So far so good!
customer_reviews.author: Garren Alexander

customer_reviews.title: After only a few months coffee grinder clogs up
customer_reviews.text: It is the second machine I have owned. The first one lasted 2 weeks before it clogged . The replacement worked for 4 months and then stopped due to clogging. Fine grounded coffee clogged and caked up. Also unable to find replacement parts . Spoke with Krug's office and was told parts needed to replace grinder top cover and shoot cover were not available. Machine is warranted for 2 years from May 29, 2018 date when replacement was received. Warranty is as good as play money. However, the cost was paid not with play money but real money. Very disatisfied with service and quality, and wish to have my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Tamara M. Warner

customer_reviews.title: Great Combo Coffeemaker with minor quirks
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Simplifies our household’s daily coffee. “Strong” brews what I find to be the perfect cup. Only thing that’s a little annoying — I hit “grind and brew”, wait til the very loud grinder is done, and then turn it off to pop out the filter. I like to shake the filter so the grounds are even, otherwise you may end up with a dry spot. I then hit the “grind off” button, and put it back to brew. It only takes a few seconds, but that adds up!
customer_reviews.author: That Jewish Custy

customer_reviews.title: Suicidal - be careful
customer_reviews.text: I had this all of 3 weeks and it committed suicide. I mean, don’t get me wrong- it just stopped pumping the water out so no coffee🤯 Everything else worked splendidly. All beeps and blinks but no coffee. I get way out of sorts if I am deprived my morning coffee. I called customer service which told me to pump vinegar water through the machine that no water was passing out of - yeah. Turns out some sensor or circuit overloaded and the coffee maker must be replaced. Well, don’t want another Krups. Going back to a simple Mr. Coffee and separate grinder. Sheesh.
customer_reviews.author: EM Goldsmith

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: It would be nice if a person would not have to pull the unit out from under cabinets to fill if they had a front fill machine it would be great also the auto set is hard to use because old people can't see the small screen But it makes good coffee and no sediment in cup like the krurig it replaced
customer_reviews.author: Joshua laufenberg

customer_reviews.title: great coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: looks no further, this coffee make is great. holds beans enough for about 3 pots worth, filter change is easy, water tank is wide enough to pour into fast and without spillage. it also isn’t super loud when it’s grinding. the coffee taste is fine, it’s not a espresso machine with a frother so don’t expect latte style creaminess.
customer_reviews.author: Bill S.I.NY

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY KRUPS GRIND AND BREW COFFEE MAKER
customer_reviews.text: We bought the Krups Grind and Brew coffee maker model KM785 D50 in November 2018. It is a very poorly constructed product that did not even last two years. First the carafe broke in an year or so, and recently the coffee maker started leaking water. Consumer products need to last at least five years or we are just contributing to waste in our world. I’ve reached out to Krups for help with repair, and will post an update on my experience once I hear from them. Meanwhile, please do not buy this product, and look for some other brand.
customer_reviews.author: Uday Turaga

customer_reviews.title: Poor performance and worse service
customer_reviews.text: The coffee maker consistently backs up so no grounds are pushed into the filter. You get weak coffee even after cleaning. I was unable to return the unit so had to deal with customer service. They took days to send me a return label. Weeks to confirm receipt. Then the replacement unit was on back order (on the phone they said it was not) so they said they would send an alternative in the meantime which would arrive in 5-7 business days. After 10 business days I wrote them and they said they made a mistake and would ship one now. Awesome performance.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Bogen

customer_reviews.title: Great.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had this for about two months, haven’t had any issues with it. Hasn’t clogged or given me issues and it’s used about 5 out of 7 days a week. My only complaint so far is that after it’s done grinding i have to open the filter and shake the holder back and forth to even out the spreading of grounds so that the coffee is brewed evenly.
customer_reviews.author: Joey

customer_reviews.title: Krups coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: HI. This Krups coffee maker is the same as my Capresso coffee maker. Except for a few minor cosmetic changes. The best part is it"s cheaper too buy!! I would recommend to a friend. Thx. Richard
customer_reviews.author: Buddy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use. Doesn’t always feed beans.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. Not super intuitive but easy enough. It doesn’t always feed the beans down to the grinder, can’t figure out why. Nothing in manual for this being an issue. Still rather loud when grinding for a conical burr grinder.
customer_reviews.author: JBrookie

customer_reviews.title: Doubles as an alarm clock.
customer_reviews.text: The grinder is loud. Makes good coffee. The little numbers inside the water reservoir are really nice. Seems well built. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: greg Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and product
customer_reviews.text: No complaints so far and Customer support is really good. Working like it should to make a delicious fresh cup of coffee
customer_reviews.author: Michelle P.

customer_reviews.title: Everyone needs this - great, fresh coffee every morning
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love our unit. We have been using daily for over a month now. It’s easy to clean the permanent filter. Took a week or so to dial the settings to our liking. Much more economical (and better coffee) than our previous Keurig single cup maker.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, but not for coffee lovers
customer_reviews.text: Coffee does not taste good. Not sure if it is from the materials that the product is made from, or the residual coffee that is left over from the previous day's brewing, for which there is little remedy. The design means that about a tablespoon of coffee stays in the chute and does not get pushed out until the next day's brewing, and anyone who knows coffee understands air is not good for coffee. It uses more beans to get the same amount of brewed coffee as compared to a basic coffee pot.
customer_reviews.author: Doug Gibson

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 2 months....customer service is a nightmare
customer_reviews.text: My old Krups Grind and Brew lasted almost 10 years with daily use and served me well; the new model broke after 2 months. Customer service at Krups is a nightmare and is not dissimilar to a colonoscopy sans anesthesia. They do not make it easy and put the onus on you. The machine itself is nice and easy-to-use and makes a pleasant batch of coffee, but it is nowhere near as robust as older models. Krups really messed up with this one. If you are looking for reliability, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Modic

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee maker/grinder
customer_reviews.text: Grinds well and brews all with the touch of a button. No issues...just good coffee.
customer_reviews.author: Parshman

customer_reviews.title: Grinder with Coffee Maker
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this item for my husband for Christmas this past year. He asked for one and I wanted to get him one that had good reviews. My only complaint is that the Burr grinder is very loud. Almost sounds like a tornado in the morning going off. Other than that, I feel its a good product and my husband seems to enjoy it as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kate Burkett

customer_reviews.title: Very much like the flexibility of having both grind and strength features.
customer_reviews.text: There are always some grounds that leak through onto the kitchen counter. I like the features and the flexibility of having both grind and strength options. I notice, however, that for my taste, which is for strong coffee, I have to set the grind on the lowest setting and the brew strength on the highest setting and still cut back on the water a bit. Others in the family, however, like the Krups grind and brew a lot, but I'm the one who cleans up the kitchen counter.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Coffee maker and grinder in one for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Love this coffee maker, makes great coffee. So easy to use and clean. Everything done in one shot, and looks nice too as an added bonus. Good quality as well. Excellent price for what you get. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Allyn O.

customer_reviews.title: Water does not saturate all the coffee.
customer_reviews.text: Water drips out in such a way that about 1/3 of the coffee in the basket will not be saturated with water. Using a paper filter in the permanent filter helps, as does only making 4 cups at a time. Definitely expected a better product from Krups. Wouldn't reccomend this at all.
customer_reviews.author: judith

customer_reviews.title: Used and defective
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed with this product. I put it all together and noticed there were coffee grounds lodged in some areas, indicating this was a used machine. Not wanting to go through the hassle of returning this product I kept it. A week or so into using it the grinder stopped working properly leaving my coffee very weak and tasting like dirty water. By this time I already threw away the box, so I was left with the hassle of having to find a box and get this to the UPS store. I’m hoping I’ll still be refunded for this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mary Krupp

customer_reviews.title: Makes great coffee but don't count on the automatic feature in the grind mode!
customer_reviews.text: The carafe tends to spill water no matter how carefully you pour. I like the beans stored on the outside of the coffee maker. I bought this particular coffee maker for the automatic feature so as to have my cup of coffee ready when I get up. But, the computerized amount to grind always reverts back to the 10 cup amount even though I've checked and rechecked the procedure before setting the automatic feature. It does not do this if I grind and drip immediately. It works fine with the grind off feature as well!
customer_reviews.author: Keith Waechter

customer_reviews.title: Sent a previously used coffee maker twice.
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited about this product. We received our first coffee maker and it had obviously been used before because they were coffee grinds in it. Despite that we cleaned it and try to use it but then it did not work right. Then we ordered a second one as a replacement. That one came also with coffee grinds in it and it was missing the canister. I’m going to give up and just return it.
customer_reviews.author: Savoy Brown

customer_reviews.title: 6 months after bought I’m out of coffee maker
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely loved it until at six months old it started clogging and not dripping. Despite my faithful cleaning and vinegar cleansing it still broke.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Burr grinder stops by timer, not quantity
customer_reviews.text: It is a good price for a burr grinder coffee machine but after using several weeks, I found the grinder did not fit for all coffee beans. For some coffee bean that is not very dry, the grinding speed was slow but the grinder still stop for the same timer. The result is not enough ground coffee in the filter (less than half) and the coffee is extremely light even set for strong.
customer_reviews.author: Krist Wong

customer_reviews.title: Reliability
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for the Krupps earlier grinder/brewer. The grinder of the original machine stopped working after about three weeks. Amazon offered replacement in 48 hour turn around. Great job Amazon!! Comments on its performance later.
customer_reviews.author: P.Viswanathan

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use
customer_reviews.text: I've used krups for years and wore out 2 krups in the last 15 years and purchased another. Enough said!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Determan

customer_reviews.title: So many design flaws
customer_reviews.text: I don't know where to begin... - when you push the button to swing ppen the filter bay, the coffee pot may go flying.... Yeah.. Broke the coffee pot on first use. Took 4 weeks for Krups to get me a replacement.... - makes very weak coffee. We have to put water in for 8 cups and grind for 10... on Strong.... - grinder stopped working after 8 months. Basically it is junk. I would not recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Smilin' Jack

customer_reviews.title: I broke the pot after the first use and it's impossible to find a replacement.
customer_reviews.text: Beware the button on the side that exposes the grounds basket, it is powerful. I pushed it, the basket flew open, taking the carafe with it and onto the floor. The coffee pot made an excellent pot of coffee (once) but now I can't find a replacement for the pot. Not sure if the was product or user malfunction. I don't want to sent the whole coffee maker back in order to get a new pot..
customer_reviews.author: Kathy S.

customer_reviews.title: Not new as claimed.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this new. Coffee grounds and residue were in the grinder and this was clearly used and refurbished.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan Mannion

customer_reviews.title: Very Convenient
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to use. It makes some noise when it is grinding, but what do you expect? My only objection is that when I set the coffee strength to strong, it isn't as strong as I like. It is still a decent cup of coffee, though.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R. Wells

customer_reviews.title: You better buy the repair insurance!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this coffee maker nine months ago and it has stopped working. The grind is working but the water doesn't heat and fill the carafe. This is the second time I have bought this coffee maker and I sent the previous coffee maker to the service center recommended and paid an additional fee of $103.00 for the repair. The repaired coffee maker worked less than a year. If this coffee maker is working, the coffee is very good but it is expensive and certainly not reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Sue Campbell

customer_reviews.title: stylish for my kitchen
customer_reviews.text: all in one, take a while before you have your grinding quality for the taste of coffee. very easy to handle. Coffee is hot for a long time, much better than other machine. I love the machine, the taste of the coffee is perfect for me, I never want more a other coffee machine.
customer_reviews.author: Brigitte

customer_reviews.title: Extra unwanted grounds ruins coffee
customer_reviews.text: This coffee maker/grinder is easy to clean and easy to use but I am very disappointed that I have to clean out a reservoir of coffee grounds EVERY DAY otherwise extra grounds made from grinding will throw off the amount that you need for the amount of cups of coffee you have set it for. The coffee maker makes good coffee but the quirky extra grounds is a hassle. I spoke to the manufacturer and she told me it had to be cleaned out daily. Noise level is about what you'd expect for a coffee grinder.
customer_reviews.author: Lila S.

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: This is a well-designed coffee maker. It is also attractive and looks good on the countertop. The only problem that I have with it is that it is very slow. It takes several minutes to make just 2 cups of coffee. But overall it is a good value. It's less expensive than others and does a good job of making good tasting coffee.
customer_reviews.author: agperry14

customer_reviews.title: We love the simplicity
customer_reviews.text: Have had other grind and brew coffeemakers but we love this one. We use paper filter basket. The water absorbed in paper filter causes a stronger coffee so we add an extra cup of water to compensate.
customer_reviews.author: Jean

customer_reviews.title: does not work
customer_reviews.text: The grind and brew function works, but when the brew function only is pushed, the water pump does not work. Also, I suspect it was used because I saw a small amount of coffee grounds in the basket when I opened up the package.
customer_reviews.author: wolfie

customer_reviews.title: This grind feature only drops the coffee into the filter one out of three times.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and it does not drop the coffee after being ground into the filter. Pot is cheap and do not open the filter door with the pot in place. Mine pushed the pot out and onto the floor and broke. Save your money it's junk
customer_reviews.author: brad bauman

customer_reviews.title: One of the best whole bean coffeemakers I've ever used.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent coffeemaker. Easily programmable and adjustable for perfect coffee taste. I really like the fact that you can store the whole beans for several brews of coffee at once and don't have to get the coffee bean bag out each time you brew. Easy maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: J Bogs

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t grind after being cleaned
customer_reviews.text: This coffee/ grind only worked for a week and stopped grinding. I followed instructions and no drink. Please contact me I registration and emailed they are closes. Please refund.
customer_reviews.author: Pinkgem

customer_reviews.title: I received exactly what it was advertised as
customer_reviews.text: I like that it makes coffee very quickly. The dislikes are it's a little large but we can deal with that.
customer_reviews.author: Royce

product_meta.title: KRUPS Grind and Brew Auto-Start Maker with Builtin Burr Coffee Grinder, 10-Cups, Black
product_meta.description:
Size:10-Cups

KRUPS Coffee Maker, Grind and Brew, Automatic Coffee Maker with Burr Grinder, 10 Cups, Black, Model KM785D50. Combining a range of impressive features with the unique taste of freshly brewed Coffee, KRUPS grind & brew Coffee maker delivers outstanding results every morning. This 10 cup drip Coffee maker is equipped with a 5 setting conical burr grinder that lets you choose your ideal grind, from coarse to fine. A highly intuitive control panel with crystal clear LCD display provides a flawless coffee making experience, with programmable auto start to schedule the brew cycle and a 2 hour keep warm feature for Coffee that's ready just when you need it. Convenience is matched by taste, with optimized settings for bold Coffee or small batch brewing. A variety of additional features round off the perfect package for exceptional Coffee, freshly brewed for a difference you can taste.
feature_bullets: 10 CUP COFFEEMAKER W/ BUILT IN GRINDER: Brew great tasting coffee at home — built in conical burr grinder grinds beans right before brewing for enticingly rich aroma and full bodied flavor (no need for a separate grinder)

AUTO START & KEEP WARM: Schedule the brew cycle to start whenever you want (great for wake up coffee); 2 hour keep warm for delicious hot coffee from first cup to last. The glass coffee pot and the filter receptacle must be washed in the upper rack of the dishwasher

BREW PAUSE & PRECISE POURING: No need to wait — pause and serve function allows for pouring a cup at any time during the brew cycle; carafe with curved spout ensures drip free pouring down to the last drop
USER FRIENDLY DESIGN: Intuitive controls and a crystal clear LCD screen ensure easy programming and use; removable gold tone filter included for hassle free cleaning
NOTE:Kindly refer to the user manual provided as a PDF manual in the product description section

EASY CUSTOMIZING: 2 to 10 cup grinder setting for customizing the amount, 5 grind settings (coarse to fine) for choosing the intensity, and brew strength selector with 3 flavor options (mild, medium, and strong)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars971 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
